discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A

If you have a hash-based indicator of compromise (IOC) and want to determine if the corresponding program has executed in your environment, searching by hash is the most direct and effective method.

Selected Answer: D
D. Hash Search

questions.question_text: You have found a hash-based indicator of compromise (IOC) in an intelligence report and want to determine if the program has run in your environment. Which search would provide all of the process’ executions over the timeframe specified?
The Falcon Detections page will attempt to decode Encoded PowerShell Command line parameters when which PowerShell Command line parameter is present?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C ("-e"). Powershell "-e" indicates that the following command fragment is "encoded"

Selected Answer: C
The Falcon Detections page will attempt to decode encoded PowerShell command line parameters when the parameter present is:

C. -e

Selected Answer: C
Answer C ("-e"). Powershell "-e" indicates that the following command fragment is "encoded"

Selected Answer: C
Answer C ("-e"). Powershell "-e" indicates that the following command fragment is "encoded".

choices.D: It will update the Search to remove that results matching the value
choices.B: It will update the Search to remove results matching on the field valid pair
choices.C: There is no Exclude form results option
choices.A: It will update the Search to remove that field name from results

questions.question_text:
While on the Statistics tab in Event Search you can click on results to perform a number of actions.

If you select “Exclude from results” what happens?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D

D. It will update the Search to remove that results matching the value

Selected Answer: D
D splunk, but for old version exam only
D Splunk....for now but this is ending soon. Falcon Query Language will be the future answer.

Selected Answer: D
Splunk SPL (Search Processing Language).
